author: {'steamid': '76561198048462190', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1419453223}
review:
Очень атмосферная и пугающая игра в жанре "походи по комнатам, вдруг там чё изменилось". Геймплэй очень однообразен, но он здесь не главное. Главное - это умелое использование классических скримеров, звуков, музыки и, создаваемое этим всем, чувство что за вами следят и что в этом доме происходит чтото очень ненормальное. Атмосфера удалась на славу - дом постепенно, день за днём превращается в настоящий ад, кишащий паранормальной активностью, с явной неблагосклонностью к игроку. Визуальный ряд игры так же очень хорош - все эти бесконечные вереницы комнат и корридоров вселяют в тебя некоторую неуверенность в адекватности происходящего, но при этом сложно усомнится в реальной возможности существования подобного здания и близлежащих территорий.
Из минусов стоит отметить очень скомканную и непонятную концовку, которая может испортить всё впечатление от игры и, как уже было написано выше, однообразный, навевающий скуку, геймплэй.

8 страшных пугол\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007752744', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1613914803}
review:
I can understand why so many people dont rate this game. It does has it flaws and can be frustrating looking for keys in the dark or wondering what you are supposed to be doing at times. You can easily miss some of the scares especially if you are looking the wrong way... And the story is vague, especially the ending.

However I think this game is way underated in the horror genre. This game scared me more than Slender, Outlast, Amnesia or any of the others. It has amazing way of filling you with dread, which progressivley gets worse as the days go by and can make you incredibly paranoid. The atmosphere it creates especially with its audio effects has to be the scariest ive experienced in a game -and i have played heaps of horror titles. You get used to some of the jumpscares, and some are really cliched. But some are so unexpectedly good your blood will run cold. This game scares more on subtle levels than in your face jumpscares though - I hate scarecrows and clowns more than ever now..

... I cant even finish scarecrow the 8 pages coz its just too scary - way freakier than slender...

8/10
Pros
 - creepy as hell            
 - panic inducing
 - atmosphere and audio are great

cons
 - can be repetitive especially if you get lost
 - key simulator
 - not enough batteries
 - lags at times

review:
Il gioco è abbastanza ben fatto e tutto sommato è in grado di far tendere qualche nervo al giocatore. L'obiettivo della casa produttrice è dunque raggiunto, il giocatore è ben immerso nell'ambientazione e la tensione subisce picchi notevoli con una certa costanza in maniera tale da mantenere sempre viva l'attenzione su ciò che accade nella casa (e alle vostre spalle). Purtroppo il fatto di dover sempre trovare delle dannate chiavi in giro per i diversi ambienti/stanze è davvero frustrante e noioso.

Voto: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198108182367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1494323254}
review:
Первый раз увидел эту игру на Ютубе. Думаю "хоть и темно, но все же что-то да видно"...Боже как я ошибался. Невидно нихрена! Нужно затратить очень много усилий и времени чтобы найти один ключ, в одной темной комнате, а потом еще больше времени чтобы отыскать дверь которую тот самый ключ открывает (а дверей здесь тьма), и так раз за разом. комната-ключь-дверь. И снова....и снова...и снова... собственно из этого игра и состоит. И это ужас если честно)) Но вот что в игре действительно офигенное, так это музыка и скримеры (если конечно некоторые из них получится разглядеть в темноте). Они все сделаны просто на славу и дают очень криповую атмосферу. Разработчики молодцы. Но правда беготня за ключами очень скоро и очень сильно выбешивает. Так же один из минусов это ужасная оптимищация.

6 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006957460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1636322642}
review:
I can see why many people may not like this game. I find it questionable, but Steam doesn't offer a middle line for reviews (and the fact that the game got me good the first time I tried it is the only reason I'm rating it positive).

My only complaints so far is the whole key-fetching system (can get annoying), the hint system forces you to wait if you don't know what to do, unless you bump straight into what you need to do, I was unable to fetch the story by the end of the game. The game's performance (mostly blamable on me because of my PC, but others with a GTX970 also complained of performance issues) is rather sporadic, especially when all the shadows are rendering (puts me to ~10FPS), so I have to wait until it turns dark to reach ~40FPS.

The game has its potential, but the execution part fell short IMO. This is also one of those games you may like, you may not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968729302', 'num_games_owned': 1937, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1469913744}
review:
Coming from someone who loves horror games (Outlast, Amnesia series, Layers of Fear, Soma, Penumbra, etc), I thoroughly enjoyed playing this game.  Warning:  This is not a fast paced game!  If you get bored with slow paced games, don't look here.  However, if you love a slow building creepy as hell atmosphere that builds and builds as the game moves along, this is the game to play.  A good blend of slow, psychological horror from the atmosphere and terrifying jump scares.  This game got my adrenaline pumping many times.  The only real complaint I have is with the last day.  I won't post any spoilers, but I was disappointed with the ending.  It does make me curious to see where they go with this franchise, however.

8/10, would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983485859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1470494336}
review:
I wonder if the extreme darkness of the game is a feature or a bug (it's a strong possibility, since there are other graphic bugs, at least in the Linux version). Even with the room lamps on, you can't see the other side of the room. Maxing bright helps a bit, playing in a dark room maybe, but I couldn't get enough contrast to see things even in supposedly well illuminated rooms. The game highlights objects when revisiting a room, but it's not enough. In the end, after barely an hour, I had sore eyes.

Other issues with the title have been mentioned in the other reviews.

It's sad dropping such a short negative review from this little playtime, but it actually hurts playing the game.

Note: since Steam now asks if I got the game for free, I should probably mention that I got the game in a SteamGifts giveaway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099274185', 'num_games_owned': 1833, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1469824168}
review: I think this game is good and does a job well of scaring you, and some parts of the game will scare you when you are not really ready for it. The graphics are really nice and the design is awesome. Some parts may have been a bit of a challenge, but this is mostly related to the story, which was a little less explained that some might have hoped. Also, this could be a good thing as this game gives much more questions than answers. Also this is good that you get to think some on your own on what really happened as not much is served beforehand. Clues and guidance were a bit lacking and some thing maybe could have been made less problematic, like finding what doors a certain key should fit into. Also, in a sense, this was a good thing, as you are constantly on the edge and not knowing really what will happen next or where you should go. Also performance could have been better i suppose. The ending i think was fitting and surely gives a feeling there would be a follow-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026882081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1549327000}
review:
Should have been named Key finder simulator. In key finder simulator the player is task with finding little silver keys that are placed in odd locations and then taking those little silver keys and finding the doors that corresponds with the right key, Unlike games like resident evil these keys do not have markings on them that tell you which door to use them on and instead relys on the simple approach of going around the mansion  and clicking every single door handle until you find the one that will unlock.

 Also sometimes keys appear when events happen so if you see something or hear something near you in the game, look toward the ground their might be a key.

The storyline to the game is given to you in what I can only call sentences basically after opening said amount of doors each day using the keys you will find a page in a room that will end the day and give you a little bit of the story and like I said before the amount of story you get from these pages is around a sentence, a good example of what you might get would look something like this Martha choked on a sandwitch today unfortunaelly we were unable to save her. 

Another problem the game has is that it does not tell the player what keys to push to interact with the game you basically have to figure it out for yourself. 

Also if I havent mentioned it already the keys spawn in some odd locations the first key spawns spoiler alert= below a sign took me around fifteen to twenty mintues to find that key and figure out how to interact with the gate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022455711', 'num_games_owned': 1662, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1468711997}
review:
Also zuerst einmal muss ich sagen das ich Pineview Drive ohne große Erwartungen gestartet habe, da die wenigstens Horror Spiele heutzutage wirklich gruselig sind. Und was soll ich sagen, ich wurde sehr sehr positiv überrascht! Natürlich ist es so das an den ersten paar Tagen nicht wirklich was passiert, das Spiel versucht halt nicht einem Horror mit dem Dampfhammer einzutrichtern, aber es baut sich dennoch schon ein wohliges Gefühl von Bedrückung aus, wenn man durch die ehrwürdigen Hallen dieses Riesenhauses spaziert. 

Zuerst natürlich noch mit viel Tageslicht und gut ausgeleuchteten Räumen ohne das man vom Haus und seinen Bewohnern großartig belästigt wird, wobei sich auch hier am Anfang schon eine große Stärke des Spiels bemerkbar macht, der Sound. Die Geräuschkulisse fand ich mit eine der besten die ich bis jetzt in Horrorspielen erlebt habe und passt immer zu der stets bedrohlich werdenden Atmosphäre im Haus, ein Wispern dort, ein tosender Sturm oder auch Schritte in dem Zimmer über einem. Diese Dinge werden noch natürlich noch mehr und vielfältiger ebenso wie das Haus seine gesamte Wirkung erst nach und nach entfaltet.

Das „Ziel“ des Spiels und des Protagonisten, jeden Tag aufs neue wieder Schlüssel zu suchen um sein Tagebuch zu vervollständigen und herauszufinden was mit seiner Frau Linda vor 20 Jahren hier geschehen ist, mag anfangs eintöniger klingen als es ist. Natürlich gibt es Tage wo man sich denkt „Alter, wo soll ich denn hin ich war doch schon überall“ aber oft führen einen die „Erscheinungen“ selbst in die richtige Richtung. Wenn man aber partout nicht weiter kommt gibt einem der Protagonist selbst einen fast schon Hellseherischen Tipp à la „Ich sollte wohl mal im Kinderzimmer im zweiten Stock nachsehen ich glaube dort bewegt sich was“ was bei den dutzenden Räumen und im Halbdunkel aber oft auch kein Fehler ist. Die Schlüssel selber sind alle durchwegs fair versteckt, wenn man sich die Zeit nimmt in Ruhe und Gründlichkeit die Räume zu durchsuchen, wer weiß auf was man dabei noch so alles stößt. ;) 

Die Grafik mag für manche vielleicht etwas Altbacken wirken, was sie vielleicht manchmal auch sein mag, aber ich fand sie persönlich jetzt nie hässlich oder sonst was. Wenn man sich im Haus genau umschaut erkennt man auch das von Seiten der Entwickler wirklich aufs Detail geschaut wurde, Betten die benutzt aussehen, Essen das am Tisch auf jemanden wartet und so weiter. Leute die natürlich einfach wie auf Speed durchrennen, auf nichts achten und alle kleinen Feinheiten bewusst ignorieren, die werden mit dem Spiel sicher keine Freude haben.

Natürlich gibt es auch ein paar kleine Mankos, keine Frage. Zum einen finde ich es Schade, dass man während des Spiels nicht mehr über das Haus und seine Bewohner erfährt durch Bücher, Zettel oder ähnliches, bin da persönlich echt ein großer Freund von, dies dürfte aber wohl für einen 2ten Teil aufgespart worden sein. Ebenfalls muss man erwähnen das sich gewisse Effekte (Visuell wie Audiotechnisch) mit der Zeit natürlich abnutzen und mit der Zeit etwas an Schauderhaftigkeit verlieren. 
Was ich für mich persönlich aber als größten Minuspunkt empfand, mag aber evtl. auch von Spieler und Spielweise abhängen, war eben die Tatsache das man an manchen Tagen wirklich herumirrt und nur darauf wartet das der Protagonist einem sagt in welchen Zimmer sich was bewegt hat um weiter zu kommen, allerdings sind diese Tage zum Glück eher selten.

So zum Abschluss bleibt nur zu sagen natürlich dieses Spiel ist kein z. B. Outlast, aber will und muss es auch gar nicht! Horror wird hier eben nicht nur durch Splatter und Gore Effekte entwickelt und aufgebaut, sondern durch die Kombination aus Dunkelheit, Beklemmung, Sound und eigener Vorstellungskraft. Also kein Spiel für Leute bei denen das Blut nur so spritzen muss. :D aber eines für Leute die einen guten Horror einem blutigen vorziehen!

Auch ein richtig fettes DANKE an die Entwickler, dafür das ich es mir jetzt zweimal überlege eine Tür im Dunkeln zu öffnen, könnte ja eine bestimmte Dame dahinter auftauchen ;) Und nochmals Hut ab habe mich lange bei einem Spiel nicht sehr so gefürchtet!
PS: Clown und Vogelscheuchen sind Freunde ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1468556076}
review:
When it comes to horror games, Pineview Drive is an interesting breed of game.

The Initial Feeling

- When you boot up the game and get into it, you're treated with an annoying start.  You're outside this large gate with a mansion just teasing you over the edge.  It takes a moment for you to find the key you need to open up the gate and dive into things.  An awkward start, though don't let that fool you into thinking you wasted your money.

Cons

- It 'can' be hard to see the jump scares, this is true.  There are a lot of things happening, sometimes you don't even see it.  A ghost is behind you and touches you (I think that's what happened) or something was on the other side of the door and you turned away missing it.  For a horror game, that can get annoying.  Though, a lot of it is repetive stuff you'll most likely see...  eventually.

- The 'Fear' mechanic of the game (The bar in the top left) is, admittedly, the downfall of this game.  Initially, I thought, 'Wow, this is new!'.  For one, I typically avoid horror games I'm unable to fight back.  They're not immersive enough for me, though I do play them from time to time due to a horrible lack of 'Good' horror titles.  Anyways, the 'Fear' mechanic in this seems to be far to random to be reliable.  Essentially (The game doesn't tell you this), when a jump scare happens, such as a phone ringing, a ghost appearing, something flying in your face, the game will pick up your actions via the mouse and keyboard.  This determines whether or not that meter drops down.  If it goes away, you die, presumably.  After much testing this mechanic, it seemed like it was far to random for you to become conditioned to not jump at various things, thus being able to progress.  Some things just drain your meter no matter what.  While being an interesting feature, it would be much more interesting if it had some consistency to it.

- It can be frustrating to try and figure out where to go.   This game pretty much requires you to wear headphones with the volume as high as your ears can stand.  I found myself wandering around most nights going 'Where do I go?'.  Eventually, the main character would give a hint then I could finally go and progress because I couldn't hear whatever I was supposed to be hearing.

- It takes...  way to long to get to the most frightening parts.  Initially it's just your cliche paranormal things before it advances into a hellish jump scare mayhem.  While the later part of that is good for the game, the first 20 nights feel more like the ghosts aren't even trying.

Pros

- It is a beautiful game, the developer should be proud of their work.  The rain looks nice, the mansion looks nice, and the weather effects do add quite a bit to the game.

- The atmosphere is spot on, with the little noises here and there to make you always wonder 'Should I be worried about?'.  You feel like you're immersed with the noises in a haunted mansion.

- Upon reaching the later nights the game becomes rather frightening.  It just takes time to get to those points.  I won't say any spoilers of what those scares are but I found them to be well done, even if some are. admittedly, hard to witness.

Final Verdict

I'd set this game as a 6/10 final review.  It's good for a one time full playthrough, if you don't become to annoyed with the 'Fear' meter.  If you can manage to get that to cooperate, the game is fairly well made.  If the 'Fear' meter worked better this could easily be an 8, if not a 9, out of ten.  Give it a try.  I'd recomeend snagging it on a Special Deal day.  Twenty bucks isn't to bad but there is no replay value and the buggy Fear can cause more frustration than enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2121, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1468525786}
review:
Game just oozes with potential but questionable design decisions make this a game of attrition where players time and patience is put to the test. 

Problems i see broken down to detail:

1) Running up and down between floors trying keys - and occasionalyl going to gates/back door to try your luck. That back door itself is bad mistake as the player cannot know if the latest key is for it or not. So around you go when keys you have doesnt go into any door. 
2) Game hints at getting the right key for the current door. But instead it counts how many keys you have. And thats it. You have to try doors again and again and maybe this time a key works. 
3) Another reviewer pointed out that there are ghosts clamoring for attention - but you cant see them because of darkness. This really is so. Darkness is an important element yes but you still cannot really see anything worth mentioning. So you ignore stuff until its right in front of you. 
4) Huge mansion. 2 floors and a yard and no way to know where you are needed next. I just spent some 3 hours running around and completing days until i just couldnt go on anymore. I care not for the notes that advance the day.  What is the point? I can see the potential - But also the flaws are so hardcoded in front of you and other reviewers state the same. I prefer tight spaces like in Anna anyday to running around in empty areas. 
5) Found a new key? Chances are you wont find the correct door anytime soon or anywhere near you. Back and forth you go. 

Dont believe me? Just pick any walktrough video on youtube or in the guides for this game. Skip around randomly - See how the player is constantly trying out doors. Why did they overdo this? I just cant get it around my head why devs decided to test the players patience like this. Sure some will like it. Some have completed the game but for me this is too sleepy material. And i sure am not scared. I dislike the mechanics too much for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014445897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1467977281}
review:
7/10

A good horror game. It has a slow start and a few issues that hinder the game's potential, but the game picks up later on and definitely becomes a much scarier game. It's a game where actually too scared actually does cause your character to die.

Talking about the cons first...

Among the game's issues, two of them stand out. The first of them is that the game can be really confusing. Basically, during most of the game, you'll be looking for keys to open doors and find notes - each time you read a note, you advance one day, and on the way you'll be collecting batteries for your flashlight and matches to light candles.

The first issue is that actually finding the keys can often be an issue. Right off the start of the game, you have to find a key to unlock the main gate... Which is lying right on the ground. But actually spotting the key is hard, because the color of the key slightly blends with the color of the ground. The game does spot items with a red contour, but only if you get really close to them - which isn't saying the game should just make items shine in the dark and make things too easy, specially since most of the game is about exploring the mansion, but the game does make it hard sometimes to find the necessary items. There were times I triggered events that were supposed to reveal keys to me and I still couldn't spot them. I admit I actually almost gave up on the game on the beginning because I was running all around the mansion and couldn't find the keys I had to find.

On this note, I should also add that using the keys will add slightly to the confusion, because the game doesn't tell them apart - it just tells you how many keys you're holding, but you have to try out each door until you find the one the key opens. However, I don't consider this a flaw. It's part of how the game works as, once again, exploration is a big part of the game.

The second issue is pacing and knowing what's the next step to take during the game. As I've mentioned at the beginning of this review, the game has a slow start. During the beginning, there's a lot of frustration involved while you're going around looking for keys to open doors and finding notes and it takes a while before things actually start to get creepy. The game is divided between 30 days and some of them are longer than others - there are days that are actually pretty easy, short and scareless to beat, while others can be a lot longer and scarier. The game's story that you learn from the notes you find don't help much in telling you where to go next. Sometimes you read a note and you think you know where to go on the next day, but then you find out you were wrong. In fact, very often it's actually better to just sit near a candle light and wait for the character to talk to himself, which is when you get tips on what to do next, so you know where to go or what to do.

Now, for the pros - which is where the game actually gets really good.

After you get past the game's slow start, you find out how scary the game can be. The game successfully creates a creepy atmosphere with a combination of elements in all the right places - statues, paintings, objects, everything makes the player feel like everything is observing him/her or that everything could be a trigger for a jump scare - even objects reflecting light in the distance can look like something creepy, like a pair of glowing eyes. As you explore the house, you'll run into certain events, some of which are pre-determined for each day, while others are random, and they're meant to, as you'd expect, scare you. And the game actually tries to measure how much you're scared, based on your response to those events. If the game detects you're scared, you lose health, so you have to do your best to stay put while the game tries to surprise you, in order to stay alive. (The problem with this "scare-o-meter" in the game is that it could actually be improved, as sometimes it doesn't work as intended. I won't spoil the actual mechanics, but I've read how it works and tried it out and there are times when I lost health even though I had no response to some events.)

There are different events that will try to undermine your health. It's not about running away from ghosts or hiding from monsters, but actually a little of everything. You never know if there is something behind the next door you open. Even events like a phone ringing all of a sudden or a whisper coming from behind you can be enough to take away your health. As you progress further on, you'll unlock more places inside the mansion and the more you explore, the more room the game has to try and catch you by surprise and the more events will be available to do so. Closer to the end of the game, actually trying to stay put in order to not lose health becomes quite challenging. You do recover health at the start of each day, but only a portion of it, so if you get scared a lot during each day, eventually the character will die. You can try to make use of daylight when a new day begins, but it lasts very little and soon everything is all dark again. And in some cases, you have to wait for night time anyway.

Even after you beat the game, there is still an extra playable mode (two, actually, but one of them is just a mode to freely explore the mansion) that adds a little more to the game. In this mode, you have to find the 8 Scarecrow letters while avoiding the Scarecrow (inspired by Slenderman, apparently). It doesn't use the health system, so getting scared is no longer a problem, but then the game is fully randomized in this mode, with no pre-determined events and random locations for items. And I'll admit that while I finished the main game without quitting at any time, this extra mode actually made me nope out of the game, which is quite an achievement since only one other game made me do it before.

I've been reading about Pineview Drive II and, personally, I believe there's a lot of potential for a sequel. If they can address the game's current issues (keys that are hard to find, knowing what to do next and the health system not always working as intended) for the next game, I could easily see Pineview Drive II becoming one of my favorite horror games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17517, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1467878542}
review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Pineview Drive
[b]Developer:[/b]  UIG International GmbH
[b]Publisher:[/b]  United Independent Entertainment GmbH
[b]Genre:[/b]  Horror

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
Seeing its asking price, I was honestly expecting at least a decent  indie horror experience the likes of which, Slender, Outlast and countless others can be used as examples over the years. You really don’t need an inflated budget to pull off an authentically frightening gameplay sequence. And yet this title has very little to show other than some fairly nice graphical details. The mansion itself isn’t half bad, if only the amount of key hunting instances wouldn’t also involve a lot of backtracking. Sadly it does and without spoiling anything from its generic plot, the game can’t sustain itself on the flimsy story it currently presents. I really wish I could have given it at least a rating of 6 (seeing as it includes Cards and Achievements), but it asks for too much and offers too little in return.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Pleasant graphics and sounds.
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Rather boring than scary.
- Overpriced.

[b]Rating 5/10[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews]Imperial Reviews[/url].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198176008658', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1529192096}
review:
You drive up to a spooky mansion. You enter its spooky gates. You unlock the spooky door. The mechanics are set. You spend the first day in tedium. Looking for unlocked doors to find keys. To unlock doors. To find keys. To unlock doors. To find keys. You stumble around in the darkness like a fitfull drunkard, because the home owners buy their bulbs at discount bulb bulk barn. You find some flashlight batteries. Your character can't figure out how to pick them up without first finding the flashlight. Because your character is an idiot. You find a flashlight. Rejoice! The flashlight casts a bright beam. At last! The flashlight drops one level in power. You're back in the darkness. The flashlight doesn't understand how to flashlight. Two minutes later, it burns out completely. You had one job, flashlight. Find batteries. Replace batteries. Spend flashlight battery power looking for more batteries.

There's spooky stuff happening. But who cares because you can't see it. Spooky stuff repeats. The ghosts are annoyed you're not paying attention to them. You visit rooms. You look for keys. You re-visit rooms. You unlock doors. You find more keys. You re-re-visit rooms. You un-lock doors. You re-re-revisit rooms. You trigger some arbitrary event. You go to sleep. You wake up and realize you have to do it all over again. You walk out the front door and leave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077734452', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1506900765}
review:
Als Kind spielte ich gern Luigis Mansion für den GameCube, nun bin ich erwachsen geworden und mag Pineview Drive. Man wird sacht eingeführt und bei voranschreiten der Nächte werden immer mehr zufällige Events eingebaut, die einen erschrecken. Die Mechanik, ein großes Haus zu betreten, welches man nach und nach erforscht und Schlüssel sammelt, um weiterzukommen, finde ich richtig gut und daher finde ich dieses Spiel noch besser als Obscuritas. Denn dort kann ich mich bei stetem Umgebungswechsel nicht an eben diese gewöhnen.

Die Geschichte wird zu großen Teilen dem Spieler überlassen, das Spiel gibt Hinweise, wenn man zu lange stockt und die Atmosphäre ist dicht. Es gibt meinerseits nur zwei Verbesserungsvorschläge. Die Schreckleiste funktioniert nicht immer. Manchmal erschrecke ich mich gar nicht und der Charakter keucht wie Hulle. Außerdem hätte ich bei dem riesigen Haus eine Map eingebaut, wo man sehen kann, welche Türen noch verschlossen sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034746981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1464358282}
review:
I'd recommend this game!
It's a game you approach with an open mind trying to understand the who, what, where, when and why? 

This is one of those games where at first you're curious what kind of horrors this game could bring about. So you dive into it and realize that you're constantly backtracking to look for keys that open other doors and then you rage quit for a couple of minutes exiting the game and then suddenly... something inside you calls you back into this game making you want to know whats behind every door so you continue running around this mansion trying to figure out what door will open next and then you become paranoid about every little thing in this house and you become completely hooked! Hahaha. 

Just a little note, based on how you react to the minor scares decreases your Health Bar/Scare Meter and the lower it gets the more scares that will appear. You could actually get through a level without a single scare if you keep your sanity together. 

The only cons I have is that unless you have a monster graphics card you'll probably need to keep the resolution low.... 
and the game is a bit on the dark side but, with the recent 2.0 update your flashlight battery will last a lot longer than before which is a plus for new comers.

review: I've just finished the game! After reading alot of reviews insulting the game, saying it's a key finding simulator, The ending is rubbish etc. I disagree, the game was amazing. I had alot fun, I was terrified about 95% while playing this game haha. At the begining it was a little confusing where do i go to, how do i find my way around. Once the shortcuts starting coming in, I started finding my way around faster. I absolutely loved the game. I jumped far too many times though haha. the ending was awesome, The only thing i'd have liked was maybe a longer ending video to kind of explain it a little better. But even so i had alot of fun at the ending. unlike most horror games, your health goes down everytime you jump etc, so for the final day it's an extreme struggle to keep still haha. 9/10 Please bring out more developers!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011706249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1446609687}
review:
Solo el payaso me caía bien, ah si y el espantapajaros.

Cuento corto: Pasas 30 dias buscando a una mujer desaparecida, descubriendo los secretos de una "mansión", abriendo puertas y mas puertas, tratando de entender los misterios, todo "bien" hasta que llegas al final y terminas diciendo "Que diablos esta pasando, que mierda es este final" y piensas "este muchacho encontró dos sensuales generadores que resuelven todo el misterio del juego" y tu corazón se rompe NO DE SUSTO si  que de DECEPCIÓN. 

Lo bueno: Graficamente es bonito, el ambiente, la mansión, los detalles. Quizás hubiesen agregado mas cosas para "descubrir" y quizás hay mas cosas, depende del gusto del jugador.

Lo malo:  La historia. Va espectacular y termina en un gigantesco WTF. Sin sentido, el juego en si, se da muchas vueltas, muchas llaves, como que pierdes el sentido de la orientación buscando.

Pudo ser mucho mejor, pero al menos para pasar un "rato" de susto, sirve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045145965', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1589840368}
review:
Kommen wir zu diesem Spiel.
Ich muss ganz ehrlich sagen ich bin überrascht über dieses Game. Dafür das es das erste Horror Game der entwickler VIS-Games ist ist es wirklich gut geworden.

Gameplay:
Das Gameplay besteht darin das Mann in und um einem Haus auf der Pineview Drive Schlüssel und hinweise finden muss um Vorran zukommen.
Die bewegungen des Charakters sind Typisch für diese Art von Games (sehr träge, langsam).
Das Setting ist Düster und Erdrückend.

Story:
Es geht im großen und ganzen darum das mann Herausfinden muss was mit Linda (ich nehme mal an die Frau des Protagonisten) vor 20 Jahren passiert ist. Dazu muss mann allerlei Rätsel lösen und Schlüssel zu fast sämtlichen Türen finden. Ja ich sagte fast, 2 oder 3 Räume konnte ich wärend des Spielens nicht öffnen.
Story technisch lässt dieses Game (unter betrachtung das es das Erste Horror Game dieser Entwickler ist) auch keine Wünsche offen.
Ja klar viele werden jetzt sagen da kann mann noch mehr raus holen. Mann die Umgebung schöner gestalten, und, und, und.

Fazit:
Böse Zungen behaupten ja das sich das Spiel Prinziep die 30 Tage über ständig wiederholt. Was an sich stimmt. Dennoch hat VIS-Games es geschafft mit Schreckverzerrten Gesichtern, einen immer wieder verschwindenden Clown, und einer echt Creepy Vogelscheuche es geschafft mir so einige Schockmomente zu verpassen.
das Spiel bekommt von mir eine 8 von 10 Punkten da ich doch kleinere aber leicht zu übersehende fehler (nur umgebungstechnisch) gefunden habe.

Danke für die aufmerksamkeit und das Lesen des Reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027358581', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1461053576}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel gespielt und auf Twitch gestreamt.
Nachdem ich es nun 31h Stunden gespielt habe muss ich sagen ein sehr ansprechendes und spannendes Game.

Es hatte eine wunderbare drückende atmosphäre die mich und meine Zuschauer eingefangen hat.
Die sounds wie auch die jumpscares sind wirklich toll gewesen. Breit gefächtere Ideen die gut umgesetzt wurden.

Ich kann das Game jede horrorspiele Freund empfehlen es, es war für mich ein "Gänsehaut" emulator *lach*
Auch das Addon das nach dem durchspielen freigeschaltet wird "Scarecrow: die 8 Briefe" ist ein schönes beiwerk die stimmung dort wird sogar noch unangenehmer und einen ticken besser als im Hauptspiel.


Nun kurz und knapp zu den Pros und Cons

Pros:
Gute Sounds (fangen einen ein) "Pssst" 
Tolle Shocker (viele verschiedene)
Steigende Spannungskurven
Leicht zu verstehendes Spielprinzip
Schöne speichermethode

Cons:
Relativ Apruptes Ende (weiss nicht ob ichs richtig verstanden habe)
Nicht für zu häufiges Spielen geeignet. (Da man die "spawnpunkte" schnell kennenlernt)
Grafisch nicht für jeden ansprechend.

Also mein Fazit aus dem ganzen ist dennoch folgendes:
Wenn ihr euch überlegt es zu erwerben, macht es. Es Lohnt sich. Ein wirklich schönes spiel und macht definitv interesse auf Teil 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1459576220}
review:
"Pineview Drive" coge el concepto de "Five Nigths at Freddy's" y no fabrica basura. Esta vez, en vez de pasar 5 noches en una pizzería, debemos pasar 30 en una mansión. Comienzas el primer día en un camino frente a la mansión. Yo decidí alejarme de la mansión por el camino y la pantalla se fundió en negro. Yo pensé "¡[i]Otia[/i], ya me he [i]pasao[/i] el juego!", pero no. Se reinicia y aparezco en el mismo punto que antes, frente a la puerta.
Cada día comienza con un resplandeciente sol, pero rápidamente llega la noche y deberemos ir encendiendo las luces de la mansión, aunque no alumbren un carajo. Durante el primer día aprenderemos el sencillísimo mecanismo del juego: recorrer la mansión buscando fenómenos paranormales como un flipado de esos de Discovery Channel. Como la casa es muy grande, a veces se hacen las tantas de la noche y no hemos encontrado nada, así que aparece una frase del estilo "Ése ruido de zambomba me es familiar, debería mirar en la habitación del joven adolescente", entonces vas para allá y pasa alguna movida rara con soniditos. Cuando acaba, normalmente aparece una llave que te permite abrir otra puerta y encontrar una página de diario. Cada vez que encuentras una página de diario y la lees, acaba el día y empieza el siguiente. Y así todo el rato. Como veis, no es la octava maravilla, ni un juegazo. De hecho, se hace monótono a veces, pero si sólo juegas cuando un cani no confunde "hay, ay o ahí", conseguirás jugar de manera muy espaciada y no hartarte.
Para complicar el asunto, al cabo de varios días, el sistema eléctrico de la casa se fastidia y sólo tendremos que apañarnos con la linterna y con las cerillas. No supone mucho problema porque hay cerillas en la casa como para cargar un barco, pero es una molestia, porque las velas que enciendes por la casa alumbran menos que ponerte la cerilla en el ojete para meterle fuego a los cuescos. También, los últimos días, en lugar de páginas de diario (en la que nos enteramos de los remedios caseros que usaban para las almorranas, su pasión por el pressing catch o su loca receta de canelones) tendremos que [spoiler]buscar fragmentos de una foto[/spoiler].
Durante 29 días haremos esto, pero el último, descubriremos que la barra que hay en la parte superior izquierda sirve para algo, y es que nos adentraremos en [spoiler]un pasillo absurdamente absurdo bajo tierra donde tendremos muchas pajas mentales que nos harán disminuir la barra esa[/spoiler]. El último día se me hizo mucho más difícil que por ejemplo, todos los anteriores, pero conseguí pasármelo no sé cómo.
Pienso que es un juego demasiado caro, porque a pesar de haberlo jugado durante unas 14 horas, la mecánica es siempre la misma, como un capítulo de [b]Bioman[/b], que todo daba igual en el capítulo hasta que sacaban el cañón triónico y lo mandaban todo a tomar por saco, sin embargo, como lo pillé por alguna oferta salvaje o un bundle furtivo, lo saqué barato y entonces sí que vale la pena. Una idea buena, que si se le hubiese añadido un toque más de aventura (coger y usar objetos, aparte de llaves) creo que habría tenido más éxito.

[b]Debe ser muy monótono recorrer durante 30 días los mismo pasillos.[/b] Claro, lo he dicho antes, pero por lo menos, casi cada día, abrimos nuevas puertas y accedemos a habitaciones nuevas.
[b]¿Da miedo o es "de sustos"?[/b] La atmósfera es muy buena, con muchos [i]soniditos[/i] inquietantes a medida que te mueves por la casa, pero hay predominancia de sustos.
[b]Por lo que dices, es un juego fácil pero largo, porque consiste en pasearte por toooda la casa.[/b] Sí, muy bien explicado. Si quieres, la próxima vez analizas tú el juego.
[b]No, da igual. A mí sólo me pagan por venir, tocar un poco los huevos con tres o cuatro preguntas y volverme al bar.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018799950', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1460759015}
review:
First of all: I want to like the game even though it is hard to do so sometimes.

[h1] Story [/h1]
[i]You playing a man who wants to discover what happend to his wife in the 'Pineview Drive' mansion 20 years ago. She is gone since then and you want to recover your lost memories.
People say no one survived more then 30days in the house since then. 
Let the fun begin.[/i]


[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
[i]
Very atmospheric but fuck the gameplay seriously... 
You ran around the house for 30days searching for goddamn keys to unlock one of the 'thousands' doors to continue the story. Sometimes you get a little advise by your protagonist so you know where you have to look... when you can remember the goddamn room he meant.
The jumpscares/scares are pretty good in this one and they will get you mostly when you do not expect them. The sounds and noises in this game are creepy as hell. A scratch there a 'psst'
there you really never feel safe until you found the clue that leads into the next day.
So the game isn't bad but sometimes the contra points annoy you too much.


Played it during the last days together with a buddy because Steam Cloud deleted our previous progress and damn this game is fun (-minus the key search) till it comes to the end. I rage quitted it. Going to finish it but for me the end killed the whole fun for me then.[/i]


Edit: We finished it and it was pretty good overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051317669', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1651566260}
review: Pineview Drive, in my opinion, is a mediocre horror game that had the potential to be much better than it is. It’s not really a bad game, but it has some major flaws that really drag it down. The good things about the game are: The atmosphere is great for a horror game. The music and sound effects are excellent and really add to the game’s creepiness. The graphics are great. And the game has some well done scares. The major flaws about the game are: The game is WAY TOO DARK even with the game's brightness setting set to its highest level. You do get a flashlight but it doesn’t last long enough. And flashlight batteries in the game are few and far between. You may have to turn up the brightness and the contrast on your monitor to their highest levels just to barely see anything when your flashlight is low on battery power. When you start up the game, you can’t skip the introduction screens. And they are fairly lengthy introduction screens. You can’t rebind the keys either. It would have been nice if the game had a built in map of the mansion to help the player with finding their way around as you progress through the game’s 30 days of terror. It would have been nice if each door had its own specific name that relates to the room that it’s for. And also if the game told you which door each key is for when you find a key. These are major flaws that make me just barely recommend Pineview Drive. It’s not bad, but it’s not great either. It’s just mediocre to me

author: {'steamid': '76561197979864325', 'num_games_owned': 2629, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1455912902}
review:
Когда вас спрашивают "Какой твой любимый ужастик?", что вы отвечаете? Doom 3? F.E.A.R.? Dead Space? Но ведь это пострелушки! Вооружен и опасен - значит бесстрашен в каком-то смысле. Моими любимыми ужастиками являются Amnesia, Outlast, Soma, Alien: Isolation. Но сейчас речь будет о совсем неоднозначном проекте - Pineview Drive.
Этот хоррор пугает совсем иными приёмами, комбинируя и нагнетая их всё сильнее и сильнее. Дело в том, что в игре 30 дней (т.е. 30 уровней), а вернее сказать слово "ночей", которые нам предстоит пережить в огромном особняке, попутно собирая страницы дневника (которые обычно завершают уровень). Чтобы добраться до страниц нужно перерыть все комнаты, чтоб открыть запертые двери нужно найти ключ, ну а ключи подбрасывают различные психотропные моменты, или просто валяются где-нибудь в других комнатах... в общем и целом - блуждать придётся подолгу.
И вот первый день, когда почти все двери заперты, довольно быстро завершается, и начинается второй. Да и вообще первая неделя пролетает быстро, а чем дальше - тем сложнее. Тем больше страшных моментов в игре, тем больше открытых комнат, которые нужно обшарить... Главное привыкнуть к атмосфере. Так как тьма приходит почти мгновенно, обволакивая игрока.
Способы напугать игрока граничат с жестоким извращением, т.к. игра действительна пугает. Дабы мне не спойлерить, вам просто придётся поверить мне на слово.
Атмосфера и саунд - самые сильные стороны игры. Звуки и музыка настолько тонко вписаны, что я настоятельно рекомендую играть в это только в наушниках, дабы прочуствовать своей кожей каждый шёпот и шорох, окружающий вас в этом темном лабиринте коридоров.
А если говорить о слабых сторонах, за что игру хочется очень сильно ругать, а разработчиков жестоко наказывать - графика, физика и игровой процесс в целом.
Слишком темно даже с максимально выкрученной яркостью, это конечно не совсем минус, но есть одно "но"... В игре просто всё очень плохо с освещением да и с графикой в целом - различные предметы в темных коридорах светятся, молнии пробивают сквозь стены, неразборчивые отражения прикрутили для галочки (а могли бы использовать их для страшных моментов), плоские мелькающие девочки (простые не объёмные картинки прямо в коридоре... да-да, многие "объекты" были созданы из фотографий, которые вам покажут в финальных титрах), убитые тени от фонарика (ну полный шлак, особенно когда речь идёт о тенях в дверном проёме), дождь на улице является обычным фоном, который не падает на землю и всегда идёт где-то за домом, забором и деревьями (т.е. сугубо в небесах, даже если вы видите дождь из далекого окна в коридоре - капли будут крупные будто он падает перед вами, но только в зоне виднеющегося неба), 3D-анимации в игре практически нет, а свечи дают самый статичный свет (словно лампочка). Все предметы намертво приклеены, двигают в игре только двери, деревья и то, что вас должно напугать. В остальном вам только и придётся, что открывать двери, одну за одной, натыкаясь на закрытые двери, а найдя новый ключ - начинать обход закрытых дверей снова и снова, и так далее... Стоит так же намекнуть об очень сложном последнем уровне, который заставит вас пережить некоторые моменты снова и снова, т.к. у персонажа происходит инфаракт от скримеров, которые игрок к тому моменту сможет запомнить.
Тем не менее - игра держит в напряжении от первых дверей до финальных титров. Не смотря на очень серьезные минусы я очень рекомендую Pineview Drive любителям очень годных хорроров, ведь мы с вами не из-за графона их запускаем ;)
P.S. Кстати, можете опробовать небольшой приквел к этой игре под названием "Passing Pineview Forest" - совершенно бесплатно!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2325, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1475960947}
review:
I see a lot of reviews complaining about it being a key finding simulator. but really, the game is much more than that. As the review from Venus explains much better than I can, when you do find a key, it isnt because you found it, but because something in the house wanted you to have it at that time. It keeps the pace of the story, rather than throwing everything (the entire house) at you at once and expecting you to find very specific clues. 

You start out returning to the mansion to find out what happened 20 years ago to a woman named Linda. When you first enter, most of the rooms are locked. So as it gets dark, you explore the yard, enter the house, and poke at the few rooms that are open. At first, its a fairly calm atmosphere, if a little creepy. Once its fully dark though, that changes. Things start happening like objects moving, hearing strange noises, lights flicker out, etc. Rooms youve been to previously have things moved in them occasionally (so its highly recommended to revist rooms youve already been to just to double check for clues). Eventually "something" will lead you to a key, or to an event that will reward you with a key. As you open more rooms, you find more pages, which gives you hints as to what happened 20 years ago. Theres no risk of finding certain pages too early, or too late, as the game gives you the right keys to get to the right pages, in the right order. 

As far as graphics, they arent bad (little dated), but I still got low fps. With a gtx970, I ended up leaving the settings on medium to keep it smooth around 50-60 fps. Its probably an optimization issue, so youll need to play with the settings yourself to see what works best for you.

Audio was fantastic. Loved the atmosphere it created. One thing that did get slightly annoying was that direction of the audio wasnt always a good indicator of which floor it came from. You might be standing on the ground floor, hear something you would swear is directly to your left, then find out it was on the floor above you. Not game breaking, but certainly a little annoying when you are hunting for clues and all you get is an audio one.

Speaking of clues, dont worry about getting stuck for too long. One of my biggest issues with indie horror games, is that it can be easy to get "stuck" and break the flow of the game if you overlook something, or just cant figure out a puzzle. This game has a very nice (and my new favorite) system for giving you hints when you get stuck/take too long to get to the next clue. After about 15 minutes or so, your character will say something along the lines of "I could have sworn I heard something outside" or "Maybe I missed something when I came through the music room", depending on the room the next clue is in. 

The story of the game is pretty good, but the ending was a little obtuse (though it does make sense). The dev has posted official explanations though if it interests you, so I highly recommend checking the discussion boards. I cant say much more about the story without ruining it, but it was certainly a shock and makes sense ultimately.

Another feature the game has that I loved, was that it "gauges" your fear/reactions. Running a lot, jerking your camera, etc, are all things that will increase the activity in the house. Youll get more sounds, more objects moving, more of the ghost appearing, all things to try and scare you even more. I loved it as it sort of forces you to control yourself to earn certain achievements. Get too scared though, and you run out of health,die, and have to reload that day.

As far as game bugs, I only found one where my character got locked in a room as part of a scene, but after the scene played out, the door never unlocked. Reloaded and it worked normally.

Speaking of reloading, the game doesnt have a save feature, but it does have a sort of checkpoint system. After everyday, the game saves before it starts the next day. The days arent super long (anywhere from 10-20 minutes long), so it shouldnt be a major issue. The longest day is probably the last, so be aware that the end day could take a good half hour and doesnt have a save.

Overall, I loved this game, and Im fairly shocked that it isnt rated much higher than it currently is. As far as indie horror (heck, even the high end horror games), this one is my new favorite. I loved the atmosphere, the random spooks, everything. The house was gorgeous, creepy, and fun to explore. Whoever made this absolutely nailed the old, haunted house vibe, and it was an absolute treat to finally find a game that lets us explore a haunted house without constant jumpscares around every turn, or chase scenes/things that physically kill you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159996075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4984, 'last_played': 1454738966}
review: Awesome concept for a game. Found especially the first 70% of the game really creepy. It has a slow buildup, but the scares are real and the ambiance really sets the tone for the game. The last 10 days leading up to the 'finale' of the game felt a bit too much like 'drawing the game out', 'repeating' alot of the same scares that went on earlier in the game. Once you've 'settled' into the setting of the game, it would've been nice to see something switch things up a bit, as to keep the game feel fresh before the final part of the game starts up. To summarize: If you like the buildup of a good horror vibe, and don't mind investigating an old mansion in the dark, unlocking new areas, and unraveling the mysteries that surrounds it, this is a must-buy. Sit down in the dark, and enjoy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062988977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1453830173}
review:
Die einzige Angst die mich nach 8 Tagen Spielzeit überkommt, ist, dass ich mich zu Tode langweile. Ehrlich, die Atmosphäre ist super gemacht. Aber die Tatsache dass man die ganze Zeit nur von einer Tür zur anderen geschickt wird, und diese auch noch immer so weit wie möglich von einander entfernt sind, so dass man die ganze Zeit eigentlich nur am Suchen nach der richtigen Tür zum gefundenen Schlüssel ist, macht wirklich jeglichen Rest von Angst zu purer Frustration! Am 8. Tag komme ich mir einfach nur noch sowas von verarscht vor! Und mein kleiner Finger droht abzufaulen weil ich ständig Shift halten muß um zu rennen. Sonst würde ich einschlafen.

Das Spiel mag meine Angst erkennen. Dumm nur wenn keine Angst übrig bleibt, sondern nur noch schlichte Frustration. Das Erkennen der Angst des Spielers reicht eben nicht aus als Spielzweck allein!
Ich kann nur jedem davon abraten dieses Spiel zu kaufen!

review: Ich finde das Spiel ist eigentlich recht gut. Es ist natürlich Ansichtssache da einige es als einseitig und langweilig empfinden da es hauptsächlich nur darum geht Schlüssel zu finden. Aber ich finde die Atmosphäre, sprich die Sounds, mega gut! Mag sein dass das Spiel einem nicht so viel Angst macht, aber die Sounds sind mit der Weile ziemlich Nervenzerreißend. Und genau sowas macht ein "gutes" Horrorspiel aus. Außerdem weiß man nicht genau wann was passiert also bleibt die Spannung durchgehend erhalten. Das einzige was ich bisschen doof finde ist dass man nicht so viele Hinweise bekommt. Manchmal beginnt man ein Tag und weiß nicht wo man anfangen soll. Aber ansonsten finde ich das Spiel super!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983684753', 'num_games_owned': 2444, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1451016008}
review:
Pineview Drive is, simply put, tedium personified. This is one of the single most frustrating and boring "horror" games I've taken a crack at, and I've played a -lot- of horror games. Credit where credit is due: the mansion where most everything takes place is well-crafted and architecturally sound, actually feeling like a real-world building in size and layout. But beyond that, I can't say this game thrilled me at all.

The game parks you out in front of the titular Pineview Drive, or at least a mansion on said drive, without being entirely clear as to why you're there. You're informed, via a monologue by the main character, that no one's been able to stay there for 30 days straight. From there, you have a mind-numbing month of hunting for keys to look forward to, including the key to the front door itself. Were this not annoying enough, most of said keys aren't available to retrieve until various "spooky" events happen, forcing you to repeatedly comb the entire house, room by room, trying to trigger their spawns. Each day of the game (which is really a night, as your character didn't think to bring an alarm clock and wake up before the sun was about to set) ends when you've found enough keys to find a note bearing a sentence or two. These notes tell the story, what little there is, at a painfully slow pace.

To make things even more frustrating, the electricity gets blown out during a storm after so many nights, and rather than  call an electrician or check the fuses himself, your character seems content to suffer with a mediocre flashlight that drains batteries at an incredibly rapid pace and candles lit with whatever matches he can scrounge. This would be fine and dandy, if not appropriately spooky, if the battery supply at all kept up with how often you need to use the flashlight to find anything. Even with supply points spawning new batteries at random if you happen to run completely out, and the flashlight recharging slightly without fresh batteries to provide a few moments of faint light, you're stuck fumbling in the dark, waiting for doorknobs to highlight in the center of your vision so you can wiggle them to see if they're locked or check the contents of the rooms behind them for the umpteenth time. It wasn't long before I was wondering why you couldn't just pick up a candle, given several of them had handles on the candleholders, and you'd be better off spending matches relighting one than messing around with the flashlight.

I'm glad the scares are few and far between, as they give the legitimate ones a bit more impact; despite being jaded to most jump scares, there was at least one that kind of got me in Pineview Drive, though I can't remember which. However, the more randomized, mild scares that take small chips out of your "sanity" bar and can end your game if you take too long to progress, eventually get annoying since there are only two or three of them on rotation.

It's unlikely you'll have to worry too much about the aforementioned sanity bar until late in the game, when you've got that much more searching to do as you've unlocked most of the mansion, thus increasing your chances of getting spooked by something. There doesn't seem to be any way of restoring your sanity, either, save for regaining a portion once you finish a night and go to bed. This becomes a huge problem on the last day, which has a gauntlet of unavoidable scares that eventually leave you too depleted to actually finish the game. I made several attempts to clear the last area, and it seems utterly impossible.

The game tries to make things a bit easier on you by offering a hint if you've taken too long to find something, but most of these hints are too vague to be of any use, especially toward the end, and at least two or three triggered after I'd already found what they were hinting at and moved on. Long story short, Pineview Drive is a massive timesink that isn't particularly rewarding, and I suggest you pass on it for your patience's sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024275338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1452373950}
review:
Wenn dir Geld nichts mehr Wert ist und du Spaß an einem atmosphärischen Horrorspiel hast, in dem der Horrer weder vorkommt, noch irgendetwas an ein Spiel erinnert und du stattdessen Stundenlang durch endlose, vollkommen nutzlose Räume läufst, um Schlüssel oder die Türen dazu finden musst,
dann ist dieses Spiel genau richtig für dich.

Für alle anderen: Es sieht gut aus, erinnert aber inhaltlich an eine Tagdemo...
Keine Monster die einem "wirklich" gefährlich werden können, außer dass sie einem den Weg blockieren, keine Rätsel und keinerlei Navigationshilfen. Du weist nie, welcher Schlüssel jetzt wofür ist, also rennst du von A nach B nach C nach D... nach Z und dann findest du dort einen weiteren Schlüssel, mit dem du dann den ganzen Sch**ß rückwärts durch gehst. MEHR NICHT!
Story ist subtil wie gar nicht vorhanden, das Ende hat so wenig mit dem rest des Spiels zu tun, dass man glaubt, plötzlich in einem anderen Spiel zu sein und das einzige "Grußelige" sind die gelegendlichen Jumpscares, die nicht mal gut sind, weil sie entweder außerhalb des Sichtwinkels sind, von Gegenständen verdeckt werden oder durch den eigenen Licht effekt überbrückt werden...

Ernsthaft. Spart euch das Geld und kauft euch lieber andere, bessere Spiele dafür, EGAL ob es 95% Rabatt gebit oder so... NEIN!

Sagt nicht ich hätte euch nicht gewarnt...

review:
Al principio parecía el típico juego de simulador de senderismo porque solo tienes que buscar una hoja al día, pero a medida que avanza el juego, todo comieza a ser más inquietante porque aumenta el nivel de terror. En mi opinión es un juego bastante bueno sobre la tematica de terror en la que he podido vivir varios niveles de saltos en mi silla. Sobre todo cuando se te acaba la pila de la linterna, es un poco... agobiante. 

Es una buena experiencia siempre que se compre a un precio económico como en un Bundle o similares. Si te gustan los juegos de terror en primera persona y asustarte de forma gratuita, es una buena recomendación

author: {'steamid': '76561198124968154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1451526783}
review:
10/10 would become a blind cave salamander again!!

Absolutely under no circumstances should you buy this game for the full asking price.  Actually, it may be best that you avoid it all together unless you like making yourself go blind while trying to see in perpetual darkness.  

How is this possible you ask?  I'll tell you.  Early on, the power goes out and stays out.  Good, considering that it was all but useless to begin with as the lights weren't very effective and would have to be turned back on constantly. Of course you still have matches, but seeing as how the candles are virtually as useless as the lights were for illuminating Pineview Drive's various rooms and hallways, that's a 'no go' too.  Wait, there's still the flashlight - thank god!  No, scratch that, it's just about the most useless thing you'll ever have the misfortune of using in any game as the batteries run out in like 30 seconds and the fractional amount you can still make use of makes a cave environment bright and sunny by comparison.

Then there's the 'key quest' the developers force you to go on each day; a day that begins 1 min. before nightfall, so you guessed it....time to go blind all over again, day-in, day-out. Also, there's the convoluted story which makes no sense and the lame jump scares which are only moderately creepy when they work right; otherwise, they're just annoying. About the only good thing going for this game is some decent sound effects/music and the achievements and trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973230221', 'num_games_owned': 14307, 'num_reviews': 849, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1451496400}
review:
So many rooms. Resident Evil 1 could learn from the size of this area. So the game is to find keys and then the door and then a further key or a letter that tell a little part of history what will awaits you. So you search and search at start you have little lights and you can burn candle and have flashlight but the lights will go after a few days and you need to find your way with the matches and batteries you have and find and need to care to not waste it, sure its not so dark that you dont see nothing but it will be hard and the areas get bigger and bigger and even places you know could spawn out of nothing the keys or other stuff. The flair is great and sound too. Its not easy to die till the end missions but to avoid some scares to get achievement are little challenges. I enjoy this game, even if some days are very short if you know where to search but damn if you search at end days whole house for 1 item and your items (batteries, matches) get used one by one and you need keep danger from all sides that is amazing. 

Really i like this game very much, but there are 2 dislikes 1 you cant make pictures with F12 and second you cant skip the long start (that is boring). Enjoy the scenes till the end and play 8 letters of Scarecrow (i doesnt do it but its a nice gimmick i think or watch the beautyful house (dont forget its an indie title) for every detail at SALES DAY after the game. One last thing, after all 1 room cant be open. Isnt it strange. WHAT IS IN IT? CAN IT BE OPEN? I give this title personaly 89 % so watch trailer and think about how much it is worth to you (5-10 so wait for 50-75% discount?!). Thank you for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011624183', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1450462281}
review:
[h1]Атмосфера - супер, геймплей - **ВНО![/h1]

   Совсем недавно в магазине рекламировалась "Passing pineview forest", и является коротким приквелом к данной игре, там необходимо из леса добраться собственно, до особняка, а в данной игре мы будем уже на его территории. Приквел меня заинтересовал, к тому же, он бесплатен, и я сразу же купил продолжение. Главному герою необходимо разгадать загадку исчезновения своей жены 20 лет назад в этом особняке. По слухам, в нем никто не мог прожить более 30 дней. Именно эти 30 игровых дней и необходимо прожить главному герою на территории особняка, Игра, в первую очередь, берет своей атмосферой, держит в напряжении. Хоррор элементы в игре это скриммеры + шикарное к ним звуковое сопровождение, заставляющие мурашки бежать по коже. Реализованы они по разному, и не представляют из себя "страшное лицо на весь экран". Звук не только в скриммерах, но и везде, шикарен. Игра нагнетает напряжение за счет звука и темноты, во время скриммеров реально щекочет нервишки. 


Плюсы: 

+ Багов не замечено
+ Атмосфера
+ Звук
+ АААААААА ****Ь ЧТО ЭТО ЗА ****НЯ!
+ ***УЯ НЕ ВИДНО ****Ь ГДЕ СВЕТ ЛЮСТР?! С 6 ДНЯ НЕ РАБОТАЕТ! ГДЕ БАТАРЕЙКИ? ГДЕ СПИЧКИ?!

Минусы:

- Игра жрет для своего уровня слишком много оперативной памяти, возможно не сразу весь объем, но через некоторое время она занимает почти 2.7 гигабайта.
- Ключи от дверей играют с тобой в прятки по всему дому - геймплей ***но
-  Нету какого то жесткого, трудного, напряженного геймплея в конце игры
- Сам по себе весь сюжет и события раскрываются слабо
- Ждать пока стемнеет, чтобы что то произошло (не менее 3 минут)
- Финал игры непонятный и тупой, внимание, спойлер: [spoiler] Включаем рычаги, запускаем какую то установку в подвале, похожую на насос или типа того, и на этом заканчивается все. WTF? Как это относится к тому, что в доме вся эта шарага  паранормальная из за проклятой куклы? Финальный видеоролик не лучше. Короче тема не раскрыта.[/spoiler]
 
9/10 Атмосфера 
 0 найденных ключей из 10 С**А!
 Любителям хоррора рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998914313', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1449910067}
review:
I am trying so hard to like this game. I really am. It's so difficult to really like a game that has obvious repition. Just running around the mansion like a chicken with its head off, frustrated by so many locked doors, and just collecting keys. Lemme explain what its really like to play this game.

Day 1: Oooooh a Mansion...Ok collect this key...Open this door...find a note... Okay! Next day!

Day 2 and onward: Collect key, find a door among 30 doors that fit it, find another key in the room, find the door that fits it among the rest of the doors, find page... Next day. Wait for a hint cue where to trigger a jump scare so a key appears, find the door that fits it among more doors that are locked, find page, next day... Search every room you been in for jump scare trigger, collect the key that appears after, find the door that fits it among more f&@&#^ing doors, find another key, another door, get page, next day, random jump scare, get key, door, page, next day, jump scare, key, door, key, page, next day...

That's essentially the game. The game does get interesting. Lights get cut off. But there is no danger of running around in the dark without lighting candles or having your flashlight on. I am only on day 16 and its wearing me out with continous reptition and obvious triggers. Waiting for a hint from the protagonist so you know where the hell to go. Also you know where to go, because with all the running around you do, you'll know the huge mansion from front to back. Because you are checking every damn door to see if your key fits it.

The sound design is the highlight of the game. It has a very scary atmosphere. But with better execution this would be such a better game. Its demo that is free is so much better, even though all you do in the demo is walk, not make much noise, and hope the hands don't get you, and kill you... This game however is a painstaking effort of running around, collecting keys, opening doors, triggering jump scares to get another key, waiting for subtle hints from the protagonist, getting a page, and going to the next day.

Get this game only if that doesn't bother you what so ever. Other then that, I cannot recommend it. It starts to lose its charm only a few days in. Those who recommend the game sees the redeeming qualities and seem to tolerate the repitious nature of the game.

Added Note:

I've beaten the game. Story makes no sense really. Jump Scares kill you making the 30th day almost impossible to finish. But not impossible, I mean, I beat it.

Spoilers but Helpful Advice:

The clown pops in random rooms, reducing your health bar. As well as the scarecrow if you look at him while he is behind you, especially when your behind a window on the bottom floor. Also the girl when she pops up at random reduces your health bar, the cat reduces health, as well as the rats. Which are random in each room. So its unfair nonsense. First horror game I ever played where Jump Scares kill you... Really stupid mechanic.

review:
Ein wahnsinnig gutes Horrorgame, super Scares ohne Ende mit vielen versteckten Kleinigkeiten und guter Story. Selbst beim Vierten durchspielen kriege ich es nicht hin, mich nicht bei bereits bekannten Scares fürcherlich zu erschrecken. ^.^

Klare Kaufempfehlung für alle Fans des gepflegten Atmosphärenhorrors. Anmerkung: Hier gibt es keine Monster, keine blutigen Zombies und es läuft auch keiner dem Spieler mit der rasselnden Kettensäge hinterher. Meiner Meinung nach gibt es in diesem Spiel keinerlei physische Bedrohung, ist aber dennoch fürchterlich gruselig und atmosphärisch. 

Nachdem ich vom Horror-Aspekt des Spiels Outlast MEGA enttäuscht wurde, ist Pineview Drive eindeutig mein Geheimtipp für den gepflegten atmosphärischen Horror. 

Last but not least möchte ich den Entwickler persönlich und natürlich auch alle Beteilligten für ihre Meisterleistung loben und erwarte sehnlichst und mit voller Elan das nächste Horrorspiel aus dem Hause ViSGames :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1449342492}
review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Adventure Horror Spiel, ohne Abwechslung.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man Spielt einen Mann der vor 20 Jahren in seinem alten Haus seine Frau verloren hat.  Jetzt ist die erstmal die Hauptaufgabe eine Lichtquelle und Schlüssel zu suchen. Hat man die Streichhölzer (um Kerzen anzuzünden) und die Taschenlampe (und Batterien) gefunden sucht man die Schlüssel, die die verschlossenen Türen im Haus öffnen. 

Der Mann steht immer kurz bevor es dunkel wird auf, sodass man gleich die Taschenlampe anmachen muss. Nun läuft man die ganze Zeit durch Haus und Probiert alle Türen aus die verschlossen sind bis man die richtige hat, dann wird man meistens mit einem neuen Schlüssel belohnt. Wenn mal kein Schlüssel da sein sollte kommt eine Grusel Einlage und man bekommt einen Schlüssel spendiert. Hat man alles Geschäft wird erscheint eine Seite die einem zum nächsten Tag bringt. Sollte man aber mal nicht weiter wissen sagt der Mann dass einem schon wo man weiter kommt.

Die Perfekte Vorgehensweise um sich viel Lauferei und Batterien zu sparen ist:
1. Warten bis man gesagt bekommt wo man hingehen soll
2. Schlüssel finden
3. alle verschlossenen Türen testen
4. Schlüssel finden
5.  alle verschlossenen Türen testen
6. Schlüssel und Zettel für nächsten Tag finden

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grafik:

Die Grafik nicht gerade die beste für 2014 eher schlecht (HL² von 2006 sah besser aus)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Musik gibt es nicht wirklich, mehr Geräusche und klänge zur Atmosphäre.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die Steuerung Ok, trotzdem wirkt alles ziemlich träge und Schwerfällig an. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ Deutscher Untertitel
+ Deutsche Sprachausgabe
+ Gruselig
- immer das gleiche Schema 
- etwas unlogisch (warum steht man erst abends auf?)
- kein Always run

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Die Idee hinter dem Spiel ist ja garnichtmal so schlecht aber diese Einseitigkeit und ständig widerholenden suchen nach den Schlüssel und testen der Türen nervt dann doch ganz schön. Ich hab gelesen das es 30 Tage geben soll und am 30igsten Tag muss man mal was anderes machen, ansonsten heisst es 29 Tage nur Schlüssel suchen und Türen testen. Am Anfang es Spiel wirkt es alles noch sehr unterhaltet aber wenn dann noch der Strom ausfällt ist wirklich der Ofen aus. Man rennt nur noch im Dunkeln rum, wenn man die Taschenlampe nicht anmacht. Wer also ein motivierendes Abenteuer erwartet ist hier falsch, etwas zum Grusel ist es zwar schon aber das macht den Rest nicht weg. Für 19,99€ ist es sowieso viel zu teuer, da kann man sich wirklich was Besseres von kaufen.

Ich bin in circa 3,5h bis zu Tag 15 gekommen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 2/10
Grafik: 4/10
Musik: 8/10
Steuerung: 4/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 4/10
